701222f-a.title: Bronx: Hall Of Fame Terrace - Loring Place North
701222f-a.text:
(1)
Hall of Fame Terrace, north side, between Loring Place North and Sedgewick Averue. The house was the B. Andrews home (1879 map) and later(l893 map) the New York Skin and Cancer Hospital. The views were
taken the same day.
January 30, 1938
P.L.Sperr
(2)
The same, another view.
January 30, 1938
P.L.Sperr
701222f-a.folder: Hall Of Fame Terrace & Loring Place North, Bronx, NY

701411f-a.title: Bronx: Loring Place North - Hall of Fame Terrace
701411f-a.text:
Loring Place North, west side, between Hall of Fame Terrace
and West 183rd Street.
January 30, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
701411f-a.folder: Loring Place North & Hall of Fame Terrace, Bronx, NY

701223f-a.title: Bronx: Hall Of Fame Terrace - Loring Place North
701223f-a.text:
Hall of Fame Terrace, at the N.E. corner of Loring Place
North.
January 30, 1938.
P. L. Sperr
